subject: Fashion
title: Luxury Logos as Status Signals
description: One-minute skill: Luxury Logos as Status Signals.

hook.text: A plain white t-shirt costs $5. Add a luxury logo and it costs $500. Same cotton, different story.

buildup.text: Veblen coined 'conspicuous consumption' in 1899â€”buying expensive things just to show that you can.

discovery.text: Visible logos act as social signals. People wearing luxury brands get better treatment from strangers.

twist.text: But over-branding backfires. Research shows the truly wealthy prefer subtle, logo-free luxury.

climax.text: The logo game has layers: the aspirational shout brands, the wealthy whisper, and the cycle repeats.

punchline.text: Logos shout status. Real wealth whispers.

quiz.question: According to research, how do wealthy consumers typically relate to visible luxury logos?
options: They prefer subtle, logo-free luxury over heavily branded items
They display logos more prominently to maximize social signaling
They avoid luxury brands entirely in favor of handmade artisan goods
